CLUE: One living in a property when sold
OUTPUT: ['Tenant - A person who occupies and pays rent for a property, often referred to as tenancy, while it is being sold.', 'Occupant - Someone residing or using space within a property during its sale process.', 'Renter - An individual who rents the property but may still live in it when the property is put up for sale.', "Houseguest - A temporary resident, not usually tied to any lease agreement and can be present during a home's sale.", 'Tenant-in-Common - People sharing ownership rights of real estate; one or more may reside in it while being sold.', 'Lodger - Someone who lives rent-free (if applicable) within the property, typically during its sale period.', 'Leaseholder - A person with an interest in a leased property that could still occupy when put up for sale.', "Residential User - Any individual using and residing within residential property, potentially while it's sold.", "Landlord's tenant - The renter under the landlord's direct management who may stay during a property's sales process.", 'Subtenant - Someone living in a property as a sub-lessee and could remain even when the main property is for sale.', "Household member - An individual residing within a home that might be occupied while it's being sold.", 'Occupant of co-op unit - A person living in a cooperative housing arrangement, who may continue during its sales process.', 'Home occupant - Refers to someone using and staying in their residence when the home is for sale.', 'Shareholder tenant - An individual with shareholding rights (in an investment property) and residing there while sold.', 'Tenancy holder - The person who holds a tenancy agreement, potentially living within the rented space during its sales process.', "Homeowner's occupant - A resident of homeownership who may remain in their dwelling when it’s on sale.", 'Rent-paying user - An individual paying rent for a property and staying during the timeframe when the home is marketed for sale.', "Home inhabitant - Any person living within a house or building, which may be occupied even while it's put up for resale.", 'Buy-to-let tenant - A renter who has entered into a buy-to-let agreement and stays during the home’s sales period.', "Fixed-term resident - Someone with an extended stay contract in a property, which could still be present when it's up for sale."]

['Inuit - The indigenous people who have traditionally inhabited Greenland and parts of Canada and Alaska.', "Eskimo - A term historically used to describe various indigenous peoples in the Arctic, including those from Greenland; often invoked in stories and legends of Greenland's indigenous culture.", 'Nuuk (Godthåb) - The capital city of Greenland, home to many inhabitants who are descendants of various indigenous groups.', "Ice Cap - While it refers to the massive ice formations in Greenland, it's not an inhabitant but a geographical feature shared with native communities.", 'Musk Ox (Ovibos moschatus) - An animal that roams alongside Inuit communities;
